titleInfo.title: Oral history interview with Mary Manier Cooper, 1980 November 10

physicalDescription.note: Excerpted from: CENTIIICooperM audio cassette recording converted to digital format in 2006.

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Excerpts from an oral history interview with Nashvillian Mary Manier Cooper, conducted on 10 November 1980 by Fred Cooper as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. In these excerpts, Cooper discusses riding the streetcars; going to attend movies; and receiving medical treatment from a pediatric surgeon in New York when she was two years old, during the late 19th century. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the Special Collections Division.

titleInfo.title: Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project : oral history

Please contact the Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219. Telephone (615) 862-5782.
